```{r}
# reading in file/data

library(readr)

file <- "C:/Users/lissa/Downloads/U.S._Chronic_Disease_Indicators__CDI___2023_Release.csv"
data <- read.csv(file)

```

```{r}
#load dplyr
library(tidyverse)
```
```{r}
# creating a tibble

tbl_data <- tibble(data)

tbl_data
```
```{r}
# Checking column names

colnames(data)

# Renaming function format for later

# {data you are creating or changing} <- rename({data you are using}, {New Name} = {Old name})

# You can add a comma between renamed data to rename mutliple things at a time

# Try to avoid spaces, special punctuation, or numbers in column names when renaming
```
```{r}
# Janitor package helps with lots of naming fixes

library(janitor)

```

```{r}
sub_data <- select(tbl_data, YearStart, LocationDesc, Topic, Question, StratificationCategory1, DataSource)

sub_data
```

```{r}
# Filtering data
fil_data <- filter(sub_data, DataSource == "Death Certificate", StratificationCategory1 == "Gender")

fil_data

```
